 Dispatch ()

Detailed Description

This class is used to get one of the main or global queue.

See also:
WorkQueue

The following example demonstrates how to use the Dispatch class.

 #include <gaia/core/Dispatch.h>
 #include <gaia/core/WorkItem.h>
 #include <gaia/core/WorkQueue.h>

 using namespace gaia::core;
 
 class UpdateUI : public WorkItem
 {
 public:
     // This method will be executed on the WorkQueue
     void run()
     {
         // Update UI here
     }
 };

 // Run UpdateUI::run() on main thread.
 Dispatch::mainQueue().async(new UpdateUI());

Member Function Documentation

static WorkQueue gaia::core::Dispatch::globalQueue ( Priority  p = DEFAULT) [static]

Returns the global queue associated to the given Priority p.

WorkItem submitted to these global concurrent queues may be executed concurrently with respect to each other.

Parameters:
[in]pPriority for the global queue.
Returns:
A WorkQueue.
static WorkQueue gaia::core::Dispatch::mainQueue ( ) [static]

Get the main queue.

This is the queue running within the main thread. Thus normally only items put on this queue can change the GUI.

Returns:
A WorkQueue.
